body.p: offers an add-on that contributes an XSpec Test Results view that provides the ability to run XSpec test scenarios and view the results directly in the application.

To install it the add-on, follow these instructions:
Go to Help Install new add-ons to open an add-on selection dialog box.
From the combo box on top, select the Community Update Site (https://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Addons/community/updateSite.xml)
Select the XSpec Helper View
plugin and the XSpec Framework (which the plugin needs) and click Next.
Select the I accept all terms of the end user license agreement option and click Finish.
Restart the application.

Result: An XSpec Run button is now available on the toolbar in . Click that button to open the XSpec Test Results view. At this point you can do the following:
Switch to the XSLT and use the Run buttons in this view to execute a particular scenario.
For each test, there is also a Show button that selects the corresponding test in the main editing area.
For failed tests, you can click that particular test to open a diff comparison between the expected and actual results.
For more information, see the details for this Oxygen XSpec Helper View add-on in GitHub.
